Detailed Description

Every caret is part of an editor and describes the position and the look of the cursor. The position is defined by the row and the column. The caret is allocated and freed by the input mapper; also the input mapper has to provide its caret by the necessary parameters for displaying the right hint (see Caret::ShowHint()) or mode.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum Caret::Mode
 

Describes the mode of the cursor.

Enumerator:
Insert  When pressing a key the character will get inserted after the cursor.
Overwrite  When pressing a key the character behind the cursor will be replaced by the new character.

Member Function Documentation

virtual void Caret::Draw (  DeviceContext *  dc,
const Rect &  bounds,
BOOLEAN  right_to_left = FALSE
)  const [pure virtual]
 

Draws the cursor.

Parameters:
dc Device context where the cursor is drawn.
bounds Bounding rectangle where the cursor is drawn. Usually the bounding rectangle has the size of the glyph below the cursor.
right_to_left If set to TRUE the cursor is above a right to left character (e. g. an Arabic glyph). This is useful for having a different representation.

Implemented in DefaultCaret, and MultiTapCaret.

INT Caret::GetColumn (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns the column of the caret. It is assured that the value is >= 0.

AbstractEditor* Caret::GetEditor (   )  [inline, protected]
 

Returns:
Pointer to the corresponding editor.

const AbstractEditor* Caret::GetEditor (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns:
Pointer to the corresponding editor.

INT Caret::GetIndex (   )  const
 

Returns the index of the item where the caret is located. The index is calculated by the given row and column. If -1 is returned, no items are available.

virtual XYDIM Caret::GetMinimalWidth (   )  const [pure virtual]
 

Returns the minimal width of the cursor in pixels.

Implemented in DefaultCaret, and MultiTapCaret.

Mode Caret::GetMode (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns the mode of the cursor (Insert or Overwrite).

INT Caret::GetRow (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns the row of the caret. It is assured that the value is >= 0.

BOOLEAN Caret::IsVisible (   )  const
 

Returns whether the caret is visible.

void Caret::SetColumn (  INT  column  )  [virtual]
 

Sets the column of the caret. A value < 0 will be converted to 0 automatically.

Reimplemented in DefaultCaret.

void Caret::SetMode (  Mode  mode  )  [inline]
 

Sets the mode of the cursor (Insert or Overwrite). Usually this also modifies the representation of the cursor.

void Caret::SetRow (  INT  row  )  [virtual]
 

Sets the row of the caret. A value < 0 will be converted to 0 automatically.

Reimplemented in DefaultCaret.

void Caret::SetVisible (  BOOLEAN  visible  )  [virtual]
 

Allows to make the caret invisible. This is useful for cursor blinking or when the editor is in the read only mode. Per default the caret is visible.

Reimplemented in DefaultCaret.

void Caret::ShowHint (   )  const [virtual]
 

Is invoked after drawing the content of the editor and enables to display an additional hint like e. g. the state of the input mapper like the tabbing-information for the multi tap input mapper. The caret should be provided with the necessary information by its input mapper.

Reimplemented in MultiTapCaret.
